data: Beyond the miserable poverty of Creston, its squalid ignorance and its rotting antiquity, there is something more appallingâ€”something that has always seemed to me like a colossal, invisible spider, gloating over the broken victims in its intangible, unbreakable web.

Beyond the miserable poverty of Creston, its squalid ignorance and its rotting antiquity, there is something more appalling--something that has always seemed to me like a colossal, invisible spider, gloating over the broken victims in its intangible, unbreakable web.
Williamson, Jack, 1908-2006; Brundage, Margaret, 1900-1976 [Illustrator]; De Lay, H. S. (Harold Saylor), 1876-1950 [Illustrator]
